description: Crashes when i want to make a calendar entry in google calendar.

This has the potential to be a great app (like a calendar with todos, journals, etc.), but unfortunately the not-very-maintained state of it makes it suck a lot. Whenever I delete an event, the thing crashes. (I'm using the personal calendar, might be different on organisation ones but yea)

Korganizer itself is a wonderful program and has been tops until 2013. By then so much KDE "support" files, akonadi and other garbage "framework" has been piled onto it, so now it has been rendered unusable in most cases, in most distros, under most conditions. What a shame to ruin a once wonderful program through "sophistication" !!
I never used it before as I was always getting errors but now work great since 1804 . The whole KOrganizer with Kmail needs tweaking to your liking before getting the most out of the app.
Does everything that I want. Works great. Haven't come across any bugs yet. Really easy to use.
Teething problems getting it going. In Australia, you have to switch to 24 hour time or you can't enter am times. I can't get notifications working. Not a viable solution for me.

Wide variety of problems, time not setting on appointments, reminder sounds not working, weird formating issues. "Help" responses always point out that it is not a "finished" app so problems are to be expected. Ok, so don't have it in the app store where regular users get "finished" apps. Very frustrating. But mot enough to send me back to Windows. Yet.
The "Submit" button on Discover reviews won't function if you try to give a one-star rating. In effect I am forced to rate it 100% better than I feel is justified.
summary: Beta software, not ready for real usrs

description: Does not write to google calendar. Can only read items added via Google's web calendar. Used to work
removed events from my google calendar without any actions on my end

The best choice for those on a Plasma desktop!
(Can be buggy when removing calendar entries and groupdav)
Very good. Compatible with Google calendar.
summary: Very good. Compatible with Google calendar

description: Broken Google Calendar integration, worked well in 18.04 version.
has everything necessary to keep track of life and can print if you need it on paper

it's the best P.I.M.(P.) suite for a PC in general. Like integration to Linux desktop. (It just needs to show emails and appointments on sddm screezen).

But, it's aboslutely SLOW opening emails. Like 30sec if there are attached pictures.

And it LOVES to CRASH.
Can't set up link with Google calendar: Google returns "browser not secure" error.
I'm just using the To Do list right now. It works well for the most part. There are a few bugs here and there but they are easy enough to workaround
summary: Just recently installed. Looks good so far

description: I thought this would be a quick alternative to GNOME Calendar and Evolution that would allow me to import iCalendar files, but it doesn't even work so this app is useless to me.
summary: Importing iCalendar file does not show any of its events

description:
Too many bugs, crashes, & freezes.

Before MS forced me to leave Win7, Outlook did what I needed. I didn't love it, but it was reliable.

Eventually I've figured how to make KOrg do what I need, but it crashes too often; still, I can reboot the program & not lose data. Minor annoyance.

Sometimes it freezes, refusing to load any calendars. The OS has to be re-booted, then. Serious pita.

I use several calendars in order to color-code types of events. Sometimes new entries will be a different color from what I chose. Haven't found a fix.

With re-occurances, when I delete, it will normally give several options (all, this one only...). Other times it will only delete all occurrances. Then I have to open the event & change the starting date to the next occurrance.

I've removed & re-installed to no avail.

The most important part of an app like this for me is to remind me and send me notifications when stuff happens. Sadly, this does not work and seems like it's more trouble getting it to work than it is worth. It's a shame because this did seem very promising at the start.

App is simply terrible. The other negative reviews are spot on. There is too much going on visually. On top of that I could not figure out how to sync an online calendar service with this app. Maybe I missed it, but, if I did then that is a problem. It is my opinion a calendar app should be intuitive and easy on the eyes since a calendar is by its very nature full of content already. The user should not have to fight thru the visual clutter (i.e., diarrhea) to look for and to complete a task.

I'm using it to sync my nextcloud caldav calendar with my system's and this one has been a great experience. It was a little tricky to get started with it, but after that it's been every bit worth it.
Very usable as calendar and to set up your schedule for the day as well as set up your appointments and tasks and much more. It should be the default in all desktop environments.

To create a simple To Do entry is IMPOSSIBLE.

You get a silly error "Select a valid collection first"

Then you try to create a Calendar and ALL the options are "Unable to start"

After looking and looking in forums and wasting time it dawns on you that Linux is free... only if you dont value your time.

AVOID.
Cannot connect to Micrsoft Outlook calendars.... this is (I think) a known bug and is a showstopper for me
summary: Cannot set up to use EWS

description: Yes there are some shortcomings to the app but as a professional photographer I find it simply indispensible. I would love to see more user friendly ways to make a pro tem appointment with alerts when the pro tem is about to expire also if there was an integration with thunderbird it would be amazing but those are just my personal wishes. I do the pro tems with a work around but even with the needed improvements this is an amazing time saver.
summary: Some shortcomings but I love it

description: Very unfortunate that this issue has been known for months and has not been fixed. This makes the application unusable without the ability to sync with google or other email providers. I really like the application but can't use it.
Very advanced, yet user-friendly. This calendar is better than any other I've seen.
Shuts directly after opening
The app won't open
the app does not open in neo

Fasnastic integration and layout, functions alll but .... 
Google Calendar does not work .... major turnoff...

If things worked as intended, this would be an excellent app. Basic things like duplicating an event, or specifying more than one day in the week for a recurring event, though, seem pretty buggy still. Still needs work, but overall going in a great direction!
Awful user experience, nothing works. simple todo wont even show up. too much bloat.

Der Kalender lässt sich schnell einrichten, vorausgesetzt, man weiss, wie. Das ist aber kein Problem, weil das Internet einem da sofort weiterhilft. Ausserdem ist es normal, dass ein so umfangreiches Tool, wie ein Kalender nicht komplett intuitiv ist.
Die Ansichten sind Anfangs etwas verwirrend, aber auch das ist nach 10 Minuten Nutzung erledigt.
Der Kalender bietet diverse Möglichkeiten zur Synchronisierung. 
NAch mehrtägigem Gebrauch sind mir nur kleine Mankos aufgefallen: Es wäre schön, wenn man die Pfeile, die anzeigen, dass in die Richtung noch ein Termin kommt anklicken könnte.
Auf kleinen Bildschirmen werden aus einem Google-Kalender importierte Termine sehr gequetscht dargestellt, da das SChloss und das google-Symbol viel Platz wegnehmen.
Kalender ohne Absturz.
Oberfläche nicht mehr zeitgemäß und nicht in deutsch.

Terminal KOrganizer geht nicht? warum so kompliziert bei Ubuntu?
sollte alles deutlich einfacher sein. jedesmal muss man den startbefehl suchen. wie sollen da nomale user jemals linux bzw ubuntu nutzen?
Immer wieder sorgt die Integration des Google Calendars für Probleme. Gerade jetzt in der Version 5.24.1 bei Plasma 5.27.8 ist diese überhaupt nicht einrichtbar.

Es muy llamativo que el programa solamente permita agregar el calendario judío y no permita agregar otro tipo de calendarios como el musulman, el chino y otros. Es claramente un acto de discriminacion y violacion a los derechos humanos.
Me encanta... peor no deja colocar las horas para las citas. Siempre se cambian a 12 MD. Por lo tanto... inservible.
Muy buena aplicación

La aplicación funciona bien y pude conectarme a mi cuenta de Google.

The app works well and I was able to connect to my Google account.
Relativamente bueno, le falta mucho que desarollar . excelente conexion con cuenta google

Creo que una mejora a su estética podría ayudar un montón en su anticuada estética. Al contrario, por esto último y porque se integra correctamente a mi cuenta de GMail configurada en el sistema es que me cambié a Kalendar.

Utilizo Neon KDE PLasma
summary: Funciona bien, pero no se ve moderno

description: impeccable, propre et non boggué
simple d'emploi
Le paramétrage nécessite une petite recherche sur le net, mais pas si compliqué en fin de compte.
Bof.j'ai tout programmé pour avoir les notifs des rdv aussi bien visuelles que sonores,mais il a pas envi.
nul et impossible a supprimer
It does not synchronize EWS, but it says what can. FIX PLEASE

Не знаю, есть ли синхронизация с другими сервисами, но с google календарём нет, хотя заявлено, что поддерживается. Видимо это связано с новой политикой "безопасности" google.
Держать в отдельном компьютере отдельнай органайзер не удобно.
Очень жаль, приложение видимо не плохое, но важную для меня функцию не выполняет.

При попытке соединится с аккаунтом google выдает сообщение "Не удалось войти в аккаунт. Возможно, этот браузер или приложение небезопасны ..."
Без возможности данной синхронизации данный календарь для меня бесполезен.
summary: Не возможно включить синхронизацию с google

description: Можете исправить потребление оперативной памяти? Для органайзера 0,5 ГБ озу в фоне это многовато. А так, удобно
